titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an George Edward Moore, [12. 1. 1937]
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original bei Timothy Moore; Kopie im BA. Publiziert (Letters, S. 172; deutsch: Briefe, S. 203; Cambridge Letters, S. 286).

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: I'm sorry I didn't come to you to day but I didn't feel quite well enough for it. Mrs Moore wrote to me that you too were having 'flue. I hope it was only a light attack. With me a 'flue, however short, has a long epilogue. And I'm just in the beginning of it. When I shall be well enough I'll come round & try to see you, for I'm sure you'ld better stay at home for several days.
